line_1: And from his Two gilt Spurs 'tis learn'd,
In human nature most exactly learn'd,
line_2: The artful man he through his masque discern'd.

line_1: But chuse to seem judicious more than learn'd.
line_2: Nor let your learning always be discern'd,
The shepherd had the crown return'd.

line_1: But the rat, who chiefly learn'd
"Let Wisdom be by past Misconduct learn'd:
line_2: "Then patient bear the Sufferings you have earn'd,

line_1: Sure to hate most the Men from whom they learn'd.
line_2: Against the Poets their own Arms they turn'd,
